I20061205-0800

- Import org.eclipse.jdt.ui and all required plug-ins as binary
- start a runtime Eclipse

=> BOOM: Dialog "Launch Error" with "The application cannot start...".

!SESSION Tue Dec 05 20:09:54 CET 2006 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 2006-12-05 20:09:54.618
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:336)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:283)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:984)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:959)

Looks like something changes in PDE for dev.properties and binary projects.  PDE no longer sticks the jars from binary projects into the dev.properties.  This was likely done to remove duplicates when the imported binary manifest includes the jar on its Bundle-ClassPath.

This is desired for "normal" binary projects, but startup.jar is still expecting the dev.properties to have something for org.eclipse.osgi is this case.  I thought PDE treated org.eclipse.osgi special in this case.  PDE either needs to include the binary jar in the dev.properties for org.eclipse.osgi or the property osgi.framework needs to point to the binary jar within the binary imported org.eclipse.osgi project.  Currently PDE sets osgi.framework to the project directory of org.eclipse.osgi.

two workarounds:

1. import org.eclipse.osgi as source
2. do not import org.eclipse.osgi as binary into the workspace.  just keep it in the target.

Brian to make this go away.
this can wait a week.  workarounds are very reasonable.
This was my fault.  It should be fixed in the next I-Build.  Just dropped the fix into HEAD.
